Hay.name: Hay
Hay.description: Dried grass used as a staple feed for herbivores.
Hay.usage: Provide as a primary forage source for animals like cattle, horses, and rabbits.
howToMake: Harvest healthy grass when it's in the flowering stage.
Allow the grass to dry in the field until it reaches the desired moisture content.
Bale the dried grass into hay bales.
Store the hay in a dry, well-ventilated area to prevent mold growth.

Grains.name: Grains
Grains.description: Cereal crops used as a source of energy.
Grains.nutritionalValue: High in carbohydrates and essential nutrients.
Grains.usage: Feed to various animals, including chickens, cattle, and pigs.
howToMake: Select and grow appropriate cereal crops like corn, wheat, or barley.
Harvest the grains when they are fully mature.
Clean and process the grains to remove impurities.
Store the processed grains in a cool, dry place.
